item.title: how do I ensure my devices are synced
item.description: What I’m looking for not costly (I really want to try Obsidian Sync but I’m not sure if it’s worth it) can sync with iPhone and iPad can sync with other Windows devices sync plugins as well make use of my OneDrive Personal storage/subscription encryption Options Syncthing usage is only free up to 20MB Remotely-save open source and free can be used with iPhone and iPad caveat: will be using the phone/iPad’s storage plugins are not synced (not sure if this is possible since sync with _ is available, but since I’m using git too I didn’t want to sync that as well) makes use of OneDrive Personal encrypted, but I personally used another OneDrive account rather than granting the plugin access to my personal one.

item.title: PowerBI Notes
item.description: i said I’ll study | just show up Resource: https://blueapache.udemy.com/course/15-days-of-power-bi Quick notes Basic data cleanup Transform data Opens Query Editor Applied steps: like undo/redo (but there’s no undo/redo feature here) can be reconfigured on gear icon, or delete Promote first row as headers: Remove blank rows: doesn’t delete rows if there’s any row that has even 1 item (like ID but others are already blank) can be filtered tho like this: Remove Duplicates don’t select any column before doing this so it looks unique value across rows if you do this whilst a column is selected, it will base unique values on that specific column Data types ensure data types are configured so computation would be correct (ie you can’t compute a string, it has to be whole or dec) for dates, you might need to use a different locale Use replace value for errors if needed

item.title: PowerShell
item.description: OR: i said I’ll study Fundamentals Variables - store values and use as arguments Functions - list of statements or reusable commands Flow Control - If, ElseIf, Else Loops - ForEach, Do-While, Do Error handling - Try, Catch, Finally Expressions - operators and operands, computation - Expressions - PowerShell | Microsoft Docs Scope Global Scope - continues to exist after session ends Script Scope - no longer exists after file is finished running.

item.title: PowerShell - Extract Zip to path
item.description: Extract zip to path PowerShell 1 2 3 if(!(Test-Path -Path "$env:TEMP\Profile")){ Expand-Archive .\Profile.zip -DestinationPath $env:TEMP -Force } tech notes

item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ An eighteen-day gap on our twin-month birthday You were born Friday, I was on the last Tuesday

item.title: WSL
item.description: Install WSL | Microsoft Learn Enable “Windows Subsystem for Linux” from Windows Features (Turn Windows features on or off), restart PC Install “Debian” from Microsoft Store Setup UNIX username and PW Update using sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade Install packages Git

item.title: yes
item.description: heart shaped hickey on your neck lips swollen, wounded, scarred bodies blended as one yes, yes, yes also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young

item.title: you'll never get it right
item.description: you tell them about you; you’re narcissist. you change your mind too fast; you’re conflicted. when will you realize you’ll never get it right?

item.title: your gorgeous face and 3.3 GPA
item.description: just when i thought you were all just a pretty face i’d open your profile to see your previous grades
